title: 'Leave Wills alone!': The public leaps to Prince William's defence as GMB's Piers Morgan calls him 'work-shy' during debate

Prince William has been hitting headlines following his trip to the Alps for a ski holiday - thanks mainly to his dance skills. 
So, it was no surprise that Piers Morgan and Susanna Reid made it the subject of a prime breakfast debate on GMB, however, it seems their viewers were less than happy with much of what was said. 
As Piers, 51, and his co-host chaired a debate, during which the prince was called work-shy, the public rushed to defend the heir to the throne, 34, telling the journalists to "leave Wills alone". Read More Meet the OTHER blonde Prince William was spotted enjoying a boozy lunch with during royal's ski trip GMB viewers rushed to defend HRH Prince William as Piers Morgan and Susanna Reid led a debate on his ski holiday (Photo: ITV) 
As Piers and Susanna were joined by several royal commentators they began to pick apart whether it was right for William to miss out on Commonwealth day to go skiing. 
This led Piers to cite the number of public engagements he'd made, claiming it was just one more than his grandfather the Duke of Edinburgh,with the group questioning whether William's behaviour was befitting of a future king, and if he was actually "work shy". 
However, it would seem that many of the show's viewers were firmly behind the Duke of Cambridge as they railed against the discussion and the apparent bashing he was getting for living a "normal" life. Read More Prince William filmed dad dancing in club where glamorous high-five hostess works Following the news of his lads' holiday in Verbier, the Prince was given a hard time on the show... and the public weren't happy about that (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
"Poor wills, he's surely allowed downtime just like the rest of us that work hard are!" Wrote @SamPip as she took to Twitter. 
And other supporters of the Royal were quick to add their support as well, with @katycakes1 tweeting: "PIERS MORGAN.. GMB back off Prince William. He's entitled to a NORMAL frw days off. He's got a lifetime ahead of him for 'duty' [sic]." 
"GMB piersmorgan hes got a lifetime of royal duties. Let him relax. Least when working he does a proper job does beatrice GMB [sic]," added @R123HES. 
Some viewers were more concerned that Williams dancing was deemed more important than issues such as famine, with @rapmonsillest asking: 
"Why is Prince Williams dad dancing getting more screen time than the famine effecting 16 million ??? amazing." 
Others seemed to think there was a special vendetta against the Prince and his brother, Harry, with @Dakota16West opining: "@GMB Give # PrinceWilliam a break FFS! If you're not slagging Prince Harry off, then your slagging off #PrinceWilliam BACKOFF! GMB [sic]." 
The backlash against Piers and his team came after it was revealed that William has been enjoying a holiday away in the luxurious Swiss ski resort of Verbiere, where he has been pictured laughing and joking on the slopes, while a video was also released of him dancing in a club.
